name: Zona Libre de la Frontera Norte (ZLFN)
implementing_agency: Secretaría de Hacienda y Crédito Público
states: Baja California, Sonora, Chihuahua, Coahuila, Nuevo León, Tamaulipas
description: Special economic zone along the northern border established 2019. Reduces VAT from 16% to 8%, ISR from 30% to 20%, doubled minimum wage, and allows duty-free imports (excluding alcohol, tobacco). Covers 43 municipalities across 6 border states to boost economic development and reduce asymmetries with the US side.
sources: Diario Oficial de la Federación (DOF). 2019. 'Decreto por el que se establece la Zona Libre de la Frontera Norte.' Mexico City: Secretaría de Gobernación; Unidad de Planeación y Prospectiva Energética (UPPE). 2023. Informe de Resultados de la Zona Libre de la Frontera Norte. Mexico City: Secretaría de Hacienda y Crédito Público.

name: IMMEX (Industria Manufacturera, Maquiladora y de Servicios de Exportación)
states: All 32 states (concentration in Baja California, Sonora, Chihuahua, Coahuila, Tamaulipas, Nuevo León, Jalisco, Estado de México)
description: Maquiladora and export services program allowing tax-free and duty-free import of raw materials and components for manufacturing goods destined for export. Requires 100% export of finished goods or minimum $500K USD annual exports. Originated in 1965 border industrialization program, expanded nationally in 1972. Modified December 2024 to tighten scope for textiles, apparel, and footwear.
sources: Secretaría de Economía (SE). Various years. Programa de la Industria Manufacturera, Maquiladora y de Servicios de Exportación (IMMEX). Mexico City: SE; Diario Oficial de la Federación (DOF). 2024. Modificaciones al Decreto IMMEX, December 2024. Mexico City: Secretaría de Gobernación.

name: NAFIN Programa Impulso - Créditos Estatales para MiPyMEs
states: All states with active partnerships; priority: Puebla, Veracruz, Yucatán, Quintana Roo, Chiapas, Oaxaca, Tabasco, Guerrero, Campeche, Coahuila, Nuevo León, Nayarit
budget_investment: Varies by state (e.g., Yucatán: 254M MXN fund)
description: Federal development bank program channeling credit lines up to 5 million pesos to MSMEs through state government partnerships and financial intermediaries. Includes technical assistance, guarantee programs, and business development services. States co-fund and administer local variants with NAFIN capital backing.
sources: Nacional Financiera (NAFIN). Various years. 'Impulso Estados: Programa de financiamiento subnacional.' Mexico City: NAFIN. https://www.nafin.com; Banco Nacional de Comercio Exterior (Bancomext). Various years. Partnership and co-financing announcements. Mexico City: Bancomext.

name: Bancomext Programas de Financiamiento al Comercio Exterior
states: All states (concentration in manufacturing/export hubs)
description: Federal export credit agency providing trade finance, guarantees, and working capital to Mexican exporters. Programs include direct credit, guarantees to commercial banks, export insurance, and technical assistance. Operates in coordination with state economic development secretariats.
sources: Banco Nacional de Comercio Exterior (Bancomext). Various years. Institutional portal: export credit and trade finance programs. Mexico City: Bancomext. https://www.bancomext.com.

name: Decreto de Estímulos Fiscales - Deducción Inmediata de Activos Fijos (Plan México)
implementing_agency: Secretaría de Hacienda y Crédito Público
states: All 32 states
description: National tax incentive decree under Plan Mexico allowing 35%-91% immediate deduction of fixed asset investments (2025-2026), reducing to 35%-89% (2026-2030). Additionally provides 25% deduction for employee training or innovation expenses (2025-2030). Applies to all qualifying investments nationwide.
sources: Diario Oficial de la Federación (DOF). 2025. 'Decreto por el que se otorgan estímulos fiscales en el marco del Plan México.' Mexico City: Secretaría de Gobernación.

name: Programa Nacional de Polos de Desarrollo Económico para el Bienestar (PODECOBI)
states: Campeche, Chiapas, Chihuahua, Colima, Durango, Estado de México, Guanajuato, Guerrero, Hidalgo, Michoacán, Oaxaca, Puebla, Quintana Roo, Sinaloa, Sonora, Tabasco, Tamaulipas, Tlaxcala, Veracruz, Yucatán
budget_investment: Varies by Polo (total portfolio >$50B USD committed)
description: Federal framework establishing special economic zones (Polos de Desarrollo) with 100% ISR credit for first 3 years (50% for years 4-6), 100% immediate deduction of fixed assets, and additional state-level incentives. Each Polo targets specific productive vocations based on regional comparative advantages. As of May 2025: 11 underway, 14 approved, 12 under evaluation. Flagship Plan Mexico program.
sources: Secretaría de Economía (SE). 2025. Marco del Programa de Polos de Desarrollo para el Bienestar (PODECOBI). Mexico City: SE; Diario Oficial de la Federación (DOF). 2025. 'Decreto PODECOBI,' May 22. Mexico City: Secretaría de Gobernación; Presidencia de la República. 2025. Proyectos México: Cartera de inversión. Mexico City. https://www.proyectosmexico.gob.mx.

name: Programa del Corredor Interoceánico del Istmo de Tehuantepec (CIIT)
states: Oaxaca, Veracruz, Chiapas, Tabasco
description: Major infrastructure project connecting Pacific (Salina Cruz) and Atlantic (Coatzacoalcos) oceans through 304km rehabilitated railway, port modernization, 10 industrial parks, and pipeline infrastructure. Covers 105 municipalities, 4.7 million inhabitants. Includes 9-10 PODECOBI zones. Target: 550,000 new jobs by 2050. Institutional Program 2025-2030 approved May 2025.
sources: Comité Interinstitucional de Infraestructura Industrial y Tecnológica (CIIT). 2025. Programa Institucional 2025–2030. Mexico City: CIIT; Diario Oficial de la Federación (DOF). 2025. Mexico City: Secretaría de Gobernación; Presidencia de la República. 2025. Proyectos México: Cartera de inversión. Mexico City. https://www.proyectosmexico.gob.mx.

name: Jóvenes Construyendo el Futuro
implementing_agency: Secretaría del Trabajo y Previsión Social (STPS)
states: All 32 states
description: Federal apprenticeship program for youth aged 18-29 who neither study nor work. Provides 12-month workplace training with monthly stipend and social security coverage. Companies and government agencies serve as training centers. Priority given to marginalized municipalities. Over 2.3 million beneficiaries. State implementation varies significantly in coverage and impact.
sources: Secretaría del Trabajo y Previsión Social (STPS). Various years. 'Jóvenes Construyendo el Futuro: Programa de capacitación laboral.' Mexico City: STPS. https://jovenesconstruyendoelfuturo.stps.gob.mx.

name: Producción para el Bienestar
implementing_agency: Secretaría de Agricultura y Desarrollo Rural (SADER)
states: All 32 states (1.84M beneficiaries)
description: Federal agricultural support program providing direct payments of 6,000-24,000 MXN annually to small and medium producers of maize, beans, wheat, rice, sugarcane, coffee, cacao, nopal, and honey. State agricultural offices administer local distribution. Replaces previous PROCAMPO/PROAGRO programs.
sources: Secretaría de Agricultura y Desarrollo Rural (SADER). 2025. 'Producción para el Bienestar: Programa de apoyo al sector agrícola.' Mexico City: SADER; Diario Oficial de la Federación (DOF). 2025. 'Reglas de Operación del programa Producción para el Bienestar.' Mexico City: Secretaría de Gobernación.

name: Sembrando Vida
states: Campeche, Chiapas, Chihuahua, Colima, Durango, Estado de México, Guerrero, Hidalgo, Jalisco, Michoacán, Morelos, Nayarit, Oaxaca, Puebla, Quintana Roo, San Luis Potosí, Sinaloa, Sonora, Tabasco, Tamaulipas, Tlaxcala, Veracruz, Yucatán, Zacatecas
description: Federal agroforestry program providing 6,250 MXN monthly to agricultural workers to plant and maintain fruit and timber trees. Over 442,685 beneficiaries. Has planted 1.2 billion trees. Administered through state-level coordination with federal bienestar delegates.
sources: Secretaría de Bienestar. Various years. Programa Sembrando Vida. Mexico City: Secretaría de Bienestar; Diario Oficial de la Federación (DOF). Various years. 'Reglas de Operación del programa Sembrando Vida.' Mexico City: Secretaría de Gobernación.

name: CONALEP - Sistema Nacional de Educación Técnica Profesional
states: All 32 states (state-funded, federal-coordinated)
description: National network of 308 professional technical education campuses offering 48 career tracks in 7 occupational areas. Provides upper-secondary technical education combining academic and practical training. State governments fund most campuses; federal coordination sets curriculum standards. Key pipeline for manufacturing, automotive, aerospace, IT workforce.
sources: Colegio Nacional de Educación Profesional Técnica (CONALEP). Various years. Institutional portal and program data. Mexico City: CONALEP. https://www.conalep.edu.mx; Secretaría de Educación Pública (SEP), Subsecretaría de Educación Media Superior. Various years. Technical education program data. Mexico City: SEP.

name: Tandas para el Bienestar (Programa de Microcréditos)
states: Priority (70%): Chiapas, Oaxaca, Guerrero, Veracruz, Tabasco, Hidalgo, Estado de México, Puebla; remaining 30% all other states
description: Interest-free microcredit program providing sequential loans starting at 6,000 MXN (600/month repayment over 10 months) with progressive increases up to 50,000 MXN for punctual payers. Targets marginalized municipalities, indigenous and Afro-Mexican populations. State-level implementation through federal delegates.
sources: Secretaría de Economía (SE). 2022. 'Tandas del Bienestar: Programa de microcréditos.' Mexico City: SE; Diario Oficial de la Federación (DOF). 2022. 'Reglas de Operación del programa Tandas del Bienestar.' Mexico City: Secretaría de Gobernación.

name: FIRA - Fideicomisos Instituidos en Relación con la Agricultura
program_type: Federal agricultural credit and guarantee system
states: All 32 states (HQ: Morelia, Michoacán)
description: Federal agricultural finance system operating through 4 trust funds (FONDO, FEFA, FOPESCA, FEGA) providing credit, guarantees, technical assistance, and technology transfer to agricultural producers through commercial banking intermediaries. 143 field offices nationwide with 40%+ in communities under 50,000 inhabitants.
sources: Fideicomisos Instituidos en Relación con la Agricultura (FIRA). Various years. Institutional portal: agricultural development finance. Mexico City: FIRA. https://www.fira.gob.mx; Diario Oficial de la Federación (DOF). Various years. 'Estatuto Orgánico de FIRA.' Mexico City: Secretaría de Gobernación.

name: Crédito Ganadero a la Palabra
implementing_agency: Secretaría de Agricultura y Desarrollo Rural (SADER)
states: Jalisco, Chiapas, Nayarit, Tabasco, Quintana Roo, Tamaulipas, Oaxaca, Yucatán, Guerrero, Veracruz, Campeche, Zacatecas (+2 others)
description: Interest-free livestock credit program for small/medium producers owning 5-40 breeding cattle (or equivalent). Supports breeding stock replenishment, equipment, infrastructure, and feed supplements. Requires enrollment in National Individual Livestock Identification System.
sources: Secretaría de Agricultura y Desarrollo Rural (SADER). 2025. 'Crédito Ganadero a la Palabra: Programa de apoyo pecuario.' Mexico City: SADER; Diario Oficial de la Federación (DOF). 2025. 'Lineamientos del programa Crédito Ganadero a la Palabra.' Mexico City: Secretaría de Gobernación.

name: CONAHCYT - Red de Centros Públicos de Investigación (CPI)
states: Multiple states (concentration in CDMX, Querétaro, Guanajuato, Baja California, Jalisco, Yucatán, Sonora, Chihuahua, Nuevo León, Puebla, Morelos, Chiapas, Oaxaca, Tabasco, Michoacán)
description: Network of 26 federal public research centers (CIDE, CIESAS, CIMAV, CIMAT, CICESE, CIDESI, CIATEJ, etc.) conducting basic and applied research, postgraduate training, and technology transfer across natural sciences, engineering, social sciences, and humanities. Restructured under CONAHCYT in 2024 with new emphasis on humanistic and social approaches.
sources: Consejo Nacional de Humanidades, Ciencias y Tecnologías (CONAHCYT). Various years. Institutional programs and funding data. Mexico City: CONAHCYT. https://conahcyt.mx; Congreso de la Unión. 2023. 'Ley General en materia de Humanidades, Ciencias, Tecnologías e Innovación (HCTI).' Diario Oficial de la Federación. Mexico City.

name: Modelo Mexicano de Formación Dual (MMFD)
states: Chihuahua, Nuevo León, Estado de México, Puebla, Querétaro, Guanajuato, Jalisco, Aguascalientes, Coahuila, Sonora (+others)
description: Federal dual education model combining classroom instruction with workplace training, adapted from the German model. Upper-secondary and higher education students alternate between school and company settings. Employers provide practical training; state governments coordinate implementation through CECyTE, CONALEP, and university systems. Particularly strong in automotive and manufacturing states.
sources: Secretaría de Educación Pública (SEP), Subsecretaría de Educación Media Superior (SEMS). Various years. 'Modelo Mexicano de Formación Dual (MMFD).' Mexico City: SEP; Diario Oficial de la Federación (DOF). Various years. 'Lineamientos del Modelo Mexicano de Formación Dual.' Mexico City: Secretaría de Gobernación.

name: Tren del Norte (Ciudad de México - Nuevo Laredo)
states: Ciudad de México, Estado de México, Querétaro, San Luis Potosí, Nuevo León, Tamaulipas
description: Major passenger and freight rail project connecting Mexico City to Nuevo Laredo (US border crossing). Construction began September 2025. Part of Plan Mexico's 5,647 km national rail expansion across 24 states. Will serve as key nearshoring supply chain corridor linking manufacturing centers to US market.
sources: Presidencia de la República. 2025. 'Plan México: Anuncios de proyectos de infraestructura.' Mexico City: Presidencia. https://www.gob.mx/presidencia.

name: Tren México-Querétaro
states: Ciudad de México, Estado de México, Querétaro
description: High-speed passenger rail linking Mexico City to Querétaro (225 km). Design speed 200+ km/h. Part of Plan Mexico national rail infrastructure program. Will enhance connectivity between Mexico City manufacturing/services hub and Querétaro's aerospace and automotive clusters.
sources: Presidencia de la República. 2025. 'Plan México: Cartera de proyectos de infraestructura.' Mexico City: Presidencia. https://www.gob.mx/presidencia.

name: Iniciativa de Manufactura Farmacéutica Nacional (Acuerdo Moderna-Liomont)
states: Estado de México (Liomont HQ), others TBD
description: Federal initiative under Plan Mexico to position Mexico as pharmaceutical manufacturing leader. Includes technology transfer agreement with Moderna and Laboratorios Liomont for mRNA vaccine production (COVID-19, dengue, cancer vaccines). Two-stage transfer: (1) fill-finish operations, (2) API and mRNA manufacturing. Goal to produce vaccines domestically and reduce import dependency.
sources: Presidencia de la República. 2026. 'Plan México: Anuncios de inversión farmacéutica.' Mexico City: Presidencia. https://www.gob.mx/presidencia.

name: Programa Nacional de Modernización de Riego 'México Se Tecnifica'
states: Irrigation districts across all agricultural states
description: National irrigation modernization program under Plan Mexico targeting 200,000+ hectares of farmland. Aims to recover 2.8 billion cubic meters of water and benefit 225,000 irrigation users through modern irrigation technology, canal lining, and water management systems.
sources: Presidencia de la República. 2025. 'Plan México: México Se Tecnifica — programa de capacitación tecnológica.' Mexico City: Presidencia. https://www.gob.mx/presidencia.
_parsed_states: Irrigation districts across all agricultural states

name: México, País de Innovación - Programa Nacional de Innovación
states: Focus: Puebla (Kutsari/Olinia), Jalisco (Kutsari), Sonora (Kutsari/semiconductors), all PODECOBI states
description: Overarching Plan Mexico innovation program with 4 pillars: (1) talent formation from childhood through postgraduate, (2) SME financing for innovation via development banking, (3) engineering services strengthening, (4) National AI Laboratory (LNIA). Flagship projects include Proyecto Olinia (Mexican EV), Centro Kutsari (semiconductors), national satellites, and unmanned aerial vehicles. Linked with 23 PODECOBI zones.
sources: Presidencia de la República. 2025. 'Plan México: México País de Innovación — programa de investigación e innovación.' Mexico City: Presidencia. https://www.gob.mx/presidencia.

name: Programa de Vivienda para el Bienestar (Infonavit/CONAVI)
states: All 32 states
description: Federal housing program targeting 1.1 million new homes (Infonavit: 600,000; CONAVI: 500,000) with zero-interest mortgages costing 700,000-1.2 million MXN each. Includes improvements to 1.5 million existing homes. Part of Plan Mexico social investment portfolio.
sources: Instituto del Fondo Nacional de la Vivienda para los Trabajadores (Infonavit). Various years. Housing credit programs. Mexico City: Infonavit. https://www.infonavit.org.mx; Comisión Nacional de Vivienda (CONAVI). Various years. National housing policy data. Mexico City: CONAVI; Presidencia de la República. 2025. 'Plan México: Anuncios de vivienda industrial.' Mexico City: Presidencia.

name: FONATUR - Programa de Desarrollo Turístico Regional
states: Quintana Roo, Baja California Sur, Jalisco (Riviera Nayarit), Guerrero, Oaxaca, Yucatán, Sinaloa (+others)
description: Federal tourism investment trust providing infrastructure development, technical assistance, and planning for tourism zones. Manages Centros Integralmente Planeados (CIP) and Parques Turísticos Industriales. Conducts 183+ tourism planning studies. PROSECTUR 2025-2030 emphasizes sustainable, inclusive growth and regional diversification.
sources: Fondo Nacional de Fomento al Turismo (FONATUR). Various years. Tourism development projects. Mexico City: FONATUR. https://www.fonatur.gob.mx; Secretaría de Turismo (SECTUR). 2025. Programa Sectorial de Turismo (PROSECTUR) 2025–2030. Mexico City: SECTUR.
